title: U.S. Military Moves Into Place for Possible Strikes in Iran
summary: President Trump has given no indication that he has made a decision about how to proceed, as diplomatic talks continue.

title: Satellite Feature on iPhone Allowed Skiers to Seek Help After Avalanche
summary: The Emergency SOS feature on iPhones can send texts to emergency responders via satellite when there is no cell tower nearby.

summary: The agency is ramping up arrests, but local pushback is complicating efforts to expand detention capacity and prevent overcrowding.

summary: Prosecutors have been repeatedly caught between the president’s insistence that they undertake weak or baseless cases and the necessity of having to go to court.

title: Administration Targets Noncitizen Voting, Despite Finding It Rare
summary: The intensified push is part of an extraordinary all-fronts effort to insert federal law enforcement into the machinery of American elections ahead of the midterms.

title: Colorado Democrats Push to Rip Up 2028 House Map for an Extra Edge
summary: A proposed ballot measure to give Democrats more seats for the 2028 and 2030 elections signals that the nation’s gerrymandering fight is likely to persist for years.

title: Texas Election Season Heats Up as Early Voting in Senate Primaries Begins
summary: Both parties’ Senate primary races are kicking into high gear.

title: Kansas, Idaho, Utah, Oklahoma in New Push to Restrict Transgender Rights
summary: In states that once focused mainly on health care and sports for transgender minors, debates now revolve around the validity of transgender identity.

title: After Activist’s Killing, Tensions Erupt Between France’s Far-Right and Far-Left
summary: The beating death of Quentin Deranque has quickly become a flashpoint between the far right and far left as France prepares for local elections next month and presidential elections next year.

title: Donald J. Trump International Airport? The President’s Company Trademarked It.
summary: The Trump organization said the move was necessary to protect the brand as Florida prepares to rename an airport after the president.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Takes the Stand in Social Media Addiction Trial
summary: Meta’s chief executive said users spent a lot of time on Instagram because of its value, as he was grilled about child safety issues in front of a jury.

title: In Guthrie Mystery, Rampant Speculation Is Like ‘Salt on the Open Wound’
summary: True crime obsessives, internet theorizers and livestreamers are complicating the investigation of the kidnapping of Nancy Guthrie, the mother of the “Today” show host Savannah Guthrie.

summary: How artificial intelligence will be used in future battlefields is an issue that has turned increasingly political and may put Anthropic in a bind.

summary: The company is at odds with the Pentagon over how its A.I. will be used. The conflict has its roots in the foundational plan for Anthropic.

summary: We interviewed our bot about what it learned on Moltbook, the A.I.-only social network.

title: Can Love Be Addictive? Many Say Yes — and It’s Changing Our Idea of Romance.
summary: Poems and songs say love should be world-shattering. The logic of love addiction suggests that it shouldn’t.

title: Ethan Hawke on ‘Blue Moon,’ ‘Reality Bites’ and the Lessons He’s Learned
summary: A best actor Oscar contender for “Blue Moon,” the star reflects on turbulent times in Hollywood and the notion of selling out: “I think about it constantly.”

summary: Contenders say the criteria for judging the category can vary from, say, the number of newcomers to the seamlessness of the ensemble.

title: Leslie Wexner Says Epstein ‘Conned’ Him, but Democrats Are Skeptical
summary: House Republicans skipped a deposition with Leslie Wexner, the retail billionaire, and Democrats said his answers were not credible.

title: Shipwreck Found at the Bottom of Lake Michigan After Nearly 150 Years
summary: The steamer Lac La Belle, which was carrying passengers and cargo, sank in a storm in 1872. Eight people died when one of its lifeboats capsized.

title: Mamdani to Reinstitute Homeless Encampment Sweeps
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani will place the Department of Homeless Services in charge of the sweeps, replacing the Police Department as leader of the interagency efforts.

title: Journalists Arrested in Cameroon While Covering Secretive U.S. Deportations
summary: An Associated Press reporter was hit and held with three other journalists and a lawyer, two detainees said, while at a center for migrants secretively deported from the United States.
